verses.text: Solomon sought therefore to kill Jeroboam. But Jeroboam arose and fled into Egypt, to Shishak king of Egypt, and was in Egypt until the death of Solomon.

verses.name: 1 Kings 11:41
verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Solomon, and all that he did, and his wisdom, are they not written in the Book of the Acts of Solomon?

verses.name: 1 Kings 11:42
verses.text: And the time that Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel was forty years.

verses.name: 1 Kings 11:43
verses.text: And Solomon slept with his fathers and was buried in the city of David his father. And Rehoboam his son reigned in his place.

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:1
verses.text: Rehoboam went to Shechem, for all Israel had come to Shechem to make him king.

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:2
verses.text: And as soon as Jeroboam the son of Nebat heard of it (for he was still in Egypt, where he had fled from King Solomon), then Jeroboam returned from Egypt.

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:3
verses.text: And they sent and called him, and Jeroboam and all the assembly of Israel came and said to Rehoboam,

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:4
verses.text: "Your father made our yoke heavy. Now therefore lighten the hard service of your father and his heavy yoke on us, and we will serve you."

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:5
verses.text: He said to them, "Go away for three days, then come again to me." So the people went away.

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:6
verses.text: Then King Rehoboam took counsel with the old men, who had stood before Solomon his father while he was yet alive, saying, "How do you advise me to answer this people?"

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:7
verses.text: And they said to him, "If you will be a servant to this people today and serve them, and speak good words to them when you answer them, then they will be your servants forever."

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:8
verses.text: But he abandoned the counsel that the old men gave him and took counsel with the young men who had grown up with him and stood before him.

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:9
verses.text: And he said to them, "What do you advise that we answer this people who have said to me, 'Lighten the yoke that your father put on us'?"

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:10
verses.text: And the young men who had grown up with him said to him, "Thus shall you speak to this people who said to you, 'Your father made our yoke heavy, but you lighten it for us,' thus shall you say to them, 'My little finger is thicker than my father's thighs.

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:11
verses.text: And now, whereas my father laid on you a heavy yoke, I will add to your yoke. My father disciplined you with whips, but I will discipline you with scorpions.'"

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:12
verses.text: So Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam the third day, as the king said, "Come to me again the third day."

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:13
verses.text: And the king answered the people harshly, and forsaking the counsel that the old men had given him,

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:14
verses.text: he spoke to them according to the counsel of the young men, saying, "My father made your yoke heavy, but I will add to your yoke. My father disciplined you with whips, but I will discipline you with scorpions."

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:15
verses.text: So the king did not listen to the people, for it was a turn of affairs brought about by the LORD that he might fulfill his word, which the LORD spoke by Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam the son of Nebat.

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:16
verses.text: And when all Israel saw that the king did not listen to them, the people answered the king, "What portion do we have in David? We have no inheritance in the son of Jesse. To your tents, O Israel! Look now to your own house, David." So Israel went to their tents.

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:17
verses.text: But Rehoboam reigned over the people of Israel who lived in the cities of Judah.

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:18
verses.text: Then King Rehoboam sent Adoram, who was taskmaster over the forced labor, and all Israel stoned him to death with stones. And King Rehoboam hurried to mount his chariot to flee to Jerusalem.

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:19
verses.text: So Israel has been in rebellion against the house of David to this day.

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:20
verses.text: And when all Israel heard that Jeroboam had returned, they sent and called him to the assembly and made him king over all Israel. There was none that followed the house of David but the tribe of Judah only.

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:21
verses.text: When Rehoboam came to Jerusalem, he assembled all the house of Judah and the tribe of Benjamin, 180,000 chosen warriors, to fight against the house of Israel, to restore the kingdom to Rehoboam the son of Solomon.

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:22
verses.text: But the word of God came to Shemaiah the man of God:

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:23
verses.text: "Say to Rehoboam the son of Solomon, king of Judah, and to all the house of Judah and Benjamin, and to the rest of the people,

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:24
verses.text: 'Thus says the LORD, You shall not go up or fight against your relatives the people of Israel. Every man return to his home, for this thing is from me.'"So they listened to the word of the LORD and went home again, according to the word of the LORD.

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:25
verses.text: Then Jeroboam built Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim and lived there. And he went out from there and built Penuel.

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:26
verses.text: And Jeroboam said in his heart, "Now the kingdom will turn back to the house of David.

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:27
verses.text: If this people go up to offer sacrifices in the temple of the LORD at Jerusalem, then the heart of this people will turn again to their lord, to Rehoboam king of Judah, and they will kill me and return to Rehoboam king of Judah."

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:28
verses.text: So the king took counsel and made two calves of gold. And he said to the people, "You have gone up to Jerusalem long enough. Behold your gods, O Israel, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt."

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:29
verses.text: And he set one in Bethel, and the other he put in Dan.

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:30
verses.text: Then this thing became a sin, for the people went as far as Dan to be before one.

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:31
verses.text: He also made temples on high places and appointed priests from among all the people, who were not of the Levites.

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:32
verses.text: And Jeroboam appointed a feast on the fifteenth day of the eighth month like the feast that was in Judah, and he offered sacrifices on the altar. So he did in Bethel, sacrificing to the calves that he made. And he placed in Bethel the priests of the high places that he had made.

verses.name: 1 Kings 12:33
verses.text: He went up to the altar that he had made in Bethel on the fifteenth day in the eighth month, in the month that he had devised from his own heart. And he instituted a feast for the people of Israel and went up to the altar to make offerings.

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:1
verses.text: And behold, a man of God came out of Judah by the word of the LORD to Bethel. Jeroboam was standing by the altar to make offerings.

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:2
verses.text: And the man cried against the altar by the word of the LORD and said, "O altar, altar, thus says the LORD: 'Behold, a son shall be born to the house of David, Josiah by name, and he shall sacrifice on you the priests of the high places who make offerings on you, and human bones shall be burned on you.'"

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:3
verses.text: And he gave a sign the same day, saying, "This is the sign that the LORD has spoken: 'Behold, the altar shall be torn down, and the ashes that are on it shall be poured out.'"

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:4
verses.text: And when the king heard the saying of the man of God, which he cried against the altar at Bethel, Jeroboam stretched out his hand from the altar, saying, "Seize him." And his hand, which he stretched out against him, dried up, so that he could not draw it back to himself.

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:5
verses.text: The altar also was torn down, and the ashes poured out from the altar, according to the sign that the man of God had given by the word of the LORD.

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:6
verses.text: And the king said to the man of God, "Entreat now the favor of the LORD your God, and pray for me, that my hand may be restored to me." And the man of God entreated the LORD, and the king's hand was restored to him and became as it was before.

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:7
verses.text: And the king said to the man of God, "Come home with me, and refresh yourself, and I will give you a reward."

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:8
verses.text: And the man of God said to the king, "If you give me half your house, I will not go in with you. And I will not eat bread or drink water in this place,

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:9
verses.text: for so was it commanded me by the word of the LORD, saying, 'You shall neither eat bread nor drink water nor return by the way that you came.'"

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:10
verses.text: So he went another way and did not return by the way that he came to Bethel.

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:11
verses.text: Now an old prophet lived in Bethel. And his sons came and told him all that the man of God had done that day in Bethel. They also told to their father the words that he had spoken to the king.

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:12
verses.text: And their father said to them, "Which way did he go?" And his sons showed him the way that the man of God who came from Judah had gone.

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:13
verses.text: And he said to his sons, "Saddle the donkey for me." So they saddled the donkey for him and he mounted it.

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:14
verses.text: And he went after the man of God and found him sitting under an oak. And he said to him, "Are you the man of God who came from Judah?" And he said, "I am."

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:15
verses.text: Then he said to him, "Come home with me and eat bread."

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:16
verses.text: And he said, "I may not return with you, or go in with you, neither will I eat bread nor drink water with you in this place,

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:17
verses.text: for it was said to me by the word of the LORD, 'You shall neither eat bread nor drink water there, nor return by the way that you came.'"

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:18
verses.text: And he said to him, "I also am a prophet as you are, and an angel spoke to me by the word of the LORD, saying, 'Bring him back with you into your house that he may eat bread and drink water.'"But he lied to him.

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:19
verses.text: So he went back with him and ate bread in his house and drank water.

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:20
verses.text: And as they sat at the table, the word of the LORD came to the prophet who had brought him back.

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:21
verses.text: And he cried to the man of God who came from Judah, "Thus says the LORD, 'Because you have disobeyed the word of the LORD and have not kept the command that the LORD your God commanded you,

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:22
verses.text: but have come back and have eaten bread and drunk water in the place of which he said to you, "Eat no bread and drink no water," your body shall not come to the tomb of your fathers.'"

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:23
verses.text: And after he had eaten bread and drunk, he saddled the donkey for the prophet whom he had brought back.

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:24
verses.text: And as he went away a lion met him on the road and killed him. And his body was thrown in the road, and the donkey stood beside it; the lion also stood beside the body.

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:25
verses.text: And behold, men passed by and saw the body thrown in the road and the lion standing by the body. And they came and told it in the city where the old prophet lived.

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:26
verses.text: And when the prophet who had brought him back from the way heard of it, he said, "It is the man of God who disobeyed the word of the LORD; therefore the LORD has given him to the lion, which has torn him and killed him, according to the word that the LORD spoke to him."

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:27
verses.text: And he said to his sons, "Saddle the donkey for me." And they saddled it.

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:28
verses.text: And he went and found his body thrown in the road, and the donkey and the lion standing beside the body. The lion had not eaten the body or torn the donkey.

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:29
verses.text: And the prophet took up the body of the man of God and laid it on the donkey and brought it back to the city to mourn and to bury him.

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:30
verses.text: And he laid the body in his own grave. And they mourned over him, saying, "Alas, my brother!"

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:31
verses.text: And after he had buried him, he said to his sons, "When I die, bury me in the grave in which the man of God is buried; lay my bones beside his bones.

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:32
verses.text: For the saying that he called out by the word of the LORD against the altar in Bethel and against all the houses of the high places that are in the cities of Samaria shall surely come to pass."

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:33
verses.text: After this thing Jeroboam did not turn from his evil way, but made priests for the high places again from among all the people. Any who would, he ordained to be priests of the high places.

verses.name: 1 Kings 13:34
verses.text: And this thing became sin to the house of Jeroboam, so as to cut it off and to destroy it from the face of the earth.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:1
verses.text: At that time Abijah the son of Jeroboam fell sick.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:2
verses.text: And Jeroboam said to his wife, "Arise, and disguise yourself, that it not be known that you are the wife of Jeroboam, and go to Shiloh. Behold, Ahijah the prophet is there, who said of me that I should be king over this people.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:3
verses.text: Take with you ten loaves, some cakes, and a jar of honey, and go to him. He will tell you what shall happen to the child."

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:4
verses.text: Jeroboam's wife did so. She arose and went to Shiloh and came to the house of Ahijah. Now Ahijah could not see, for his eyes were dim because of his age.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:5
verses.text: And the LORD said to Ahijah, "Behold, the wife of Jeroboam is coming to inquire of you concerning her son, for he is sick. Thus and thus shall you say to her." When she came, she pretended to be another woman.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:6
verses.text: But when Ahijah heard the sound of her feet, as she came in at the door, he said, "Come in, wife of Jeroboam. Why do you pretend to be another? For I am charged with unbearable news for you.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:7
verses.text: Go, tell Jeroboam, 'Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel: "Because I exalted you from among the people and made you leader over my people Israel

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:8
verses.text: and tore the kingdom away from the house of David and gave it to you, and yet you have not been like my servant David, who kept my commandments and followed me with all his heart, doing only that which was right in my eyes,

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:9
verses.text: but you have done evil above all who were before you and have gone and made for yourself other gods and metal images, provoking me to anger, and have cast me behind your back,

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:10
verses.text: therefore behold, I will bring harm upon the house of Jeroboam and will cut off from Jeroboam every male, both bond and free in Israel, and will burn up the house of Jeroboam, as a man burns up dung until it is all gone.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:11
verses.text: Anyone belonging to Jeroboam who dies in the city the dogs shall eat, and anyone who dies in the open country the birds of the heavens shall eat, for the LORD has spoken it."'

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:12
verses.text: Arise therefore, go to your house. When your feet enter the city, the child shall die.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:13
verses.text: And all Israel shall mourn for him and bury him, for he only of Jeroboam shall come to the grave, because in him there is found something pleasing to the LORD, the God of Israel, in the house of Jeroboam.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:14
verses.text: Moreover, the LORD will raise up for himself a king over Israel who shall cut off the house of Jeroboam today. And henceforth,

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:15
verses.text: the LORD will strike Israel as a reed is shaken in the water, and root up Israel out of this good land that he gave to their fathers and scatter them beyond the Euphrates, because they have made their Asherim, provoking the LORD to anger.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:16
verses.text: And he will give Israel up because of the sins of Jeroboam, which he sinned and made Israel to sin."

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:17
verses.text: Then Jeroboam's wife arose and departed and came to Tirzah. And as she came to the threshold of the house, the child died.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:18
verses.text: And all Israel buried him and mourned for him, according to the word of the LORD, which he spoke by his servant Ahijah the prophet.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:19
verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, how he warred and how he reigned, behold, they are written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:20
verses.text: And the time that Jeroboam reigned was twenty-two years. And he slept with his fathers, and Nadab his son reigned in his place.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:21
verses.text: Now Rehoboam the son of Solomon reigned in Judah. Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city that the LORD had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, to put his name there. His mother's name was Naamah the Ammonite.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:22
verses.text: And Judah did what was evil in the sight of the LORD, and they provoked him to jealousy with their sins that they committed, more than all that their fathers had done.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:23
verses.text: For they also built for themselves high places and pillars and Asherim on every high hill and under every green tree,

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:24
verses.text: and there were also male cult prostitutes in the land. They did according to all the abominations of the nations that the LORD drove out before the people of Israel.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:25
verses.text: In the fifth year of King Rehoboam, Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:26
verses.text: He took away the treasures of the house of the LORD and the treasures of the king's house. He took away everything. He also took away all the shields of gold that Solomon had made,

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:27
verses.text: and King Rehoboam made in their place shields of bronze, and committed them to the hands of the officers of the guard, who kept the door of the king's house.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:28
verses.text: And as often as the king went into the house of the LORD, the guard carried them and brought them back to the guardroom.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:29
verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Rehoboam and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:30
verses.text: And there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam continually.

verses.name: 1 Kings 14:31
verses.text: And Rehoboam slept with his fathers and was buried with his fathers in the city of David. His mother's name was Naamah the Ammonite. And Abijam his son reigned in his place.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:1
verses.text: Now in the eighteenth year of King Jeroboam the son of Nebat, Abijam began to reign over Judah.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:2
verses.text: He reigned for three years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Maacah the daughter of Abishalom.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:3
verses.text: And he walked in all the sins that his father did before him, and his heart was not wholly true to the LORD his God, as the heart of David his father.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:4
verses.text: Nevertheless, for David's sake the LORD his God gave him a lamp in Jerusalem, setting up his son after him, and establishing Jerusalem,

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:5
verses.text: because David did what was right in the eyes of the LORD and did not turn aside from anything that he commanded him all the days of his life, except in the matter of Uriah the Hittite.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:6
verses.text: Now there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all the days of his life.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:7
verses.text: The rest of the acts of Abijam and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah? And there was war between Abijam and Jeroboam.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:8
verses.text: And Abijam slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David. And Asa his son reigned in his place.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:9
verses.text: In the twentieth year of Jeroboam king of Israel, Asa began to reign over Judah,

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:10
verses.text: and he reigned forty-one years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Maacah the daughter of Abishalom.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:11
verses.text: And Asa did what was right in the eyes of the LORD, as David his father had done.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:12
verses.text: He put away the male cult prostitutes out of the land and removed all the idols that his fathers had made.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:13
verses.text: He also removed Maacah his mother from being queen mother because she had made an abominable image for Asherah. And Asa cut down her image and burned it at the brook Kidron.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:14
verses.text: But the high places were not taken away. Nevertheless, the heart of Asa was wholly true to the LORD all his days.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:15
verses.text: And he brought into the house of the LORD the sacred gifts of his father and his own sacred gifts, silver, and gold, and vessels.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:16
verses.text: And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:17
verses.text: Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah and built Ramah, that he might permit no one to go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:18
verses.text: Then Asa took all the silver and the gold that were left in the treasures of the house of the LORD and the treasures of the king's house and gave them into the hands of his servants. And King Asa sent them to Ben-hadad the son of Tabrimmon, the son of Hezion, king of Syria, who lived in Damascus, saying,

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:19
verses.text: "Let there be a covenant between me and you, as there was between my father and your father. Behold, I am sending to you a present of silver and gold. Go, break your covenant with Baasha king of Israel, that he may withdraw from me."

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:20
verses.text: And Ben-hadad listened to King Asa and sent the commanders of his armies against the cities of Israel and conquered Ijon, Dan, Abel-beth-maacah, and all Chinneroth, with all the land of Naphtali.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:21
verses.text: And when Baasha heard of it, he stopped building Ramah, and he lived in Tirzah.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:22
verses.text: Then King Asa made a proclamation to all Judah, none was exempt, and they carried away the stones of Ramah and its timber, with which Baasha had been building, and with them King Asa built Geba of Benjamin and Mizpah.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:23
verses.text: Now the rest of all the acts of Asa, all his might, and all that he did, and the cities that he built, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah? But in his old age he was diseased in his feet.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:24
verses.text: And Asa slept with his fathers and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father, and Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his place.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:25
verses.text: Nadab the son of Jeroboam began to reign over Israel in the second year of Asa king of Judah, and he reigned over Israel two years.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:26
verses.text: He did what was evil in the sight of the LORD and walked in the way of his father, and in his sin which he made Israel to sin.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:27
verses.text: Baasha the son of Ahijah, of the house of Issachar, conspired against him. And Baasha struck him down at Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines, for Nadab and all Israel were laying siege to Gibbethon.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:28
verses.text: So Baasha killed him in the third year of Asa king of Judah and reigned in his place.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:29
verses.text: And as soon as he was king, he killed all the house of Jeroboam. He left to the house of Jeroboam not one that breathed, until he had destroyed it, according to the word of the LORD that he spoke by his servant Ahijah the Shilonite.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:30
verses.text: It was for the sins of Jeroboam that he sinned and that he made Israel to sin, and because of the anger to which he provoked the LORD, the God of Israel.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:31
verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Nadab and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:32
verses.text: And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:33
verses.text: In the third year of Asa king of Judah, Baasha the son of Ahijah began to reign over all Israel at Tirzah, and he reigned twenty-four years.

verses.name: 1 Kings 15:34
verses.text: He did what was evil in the sight of the LORD and walked in the way of Jeroboam and in his sin which he made Israel to sin.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:1
verses.text: And the word of the LORD came to Jehu the son of Hanani against Baasha, saying,

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:2
verses.text: "Since I exalted you out of the dust and made you leader over my people Israel, and you have walked in the way of Jeroboam and have made my people Israel to sin, provoking me to anger with their sins,

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:3
verses.text: behold, I will utterly sweep away Baasha and his house, and I will make your house like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:4
verses.text: Anyone belonging to Baasha who dies in the city the dogs shall eat, and anyone of his who dies in the field the birds of the heavens shall eat."

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:5
verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Baasha and what he did, and his might, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:6
verses.text: And Baasha slept with his fathers and was buried at Tirzah, and Elah his son reigned in his place.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:7
verses.text: Moreover, the word of the LORD came by the prophet Jehu the son of Hanani against Baasha and his house, both because of all the evil that he did in the sight of the LORD, provoking him to anger with the work of his hands, in being like the house of Jeroboam, and also because he destroyed it.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:8
verses.text: In the twenty-sixth year of Asa king of Judah, Elah the son of Baasha began to reign over Israel in Tirzah, and he reigned two years.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:9
verses.text: But his servant Zimri, commander of half his chariots, conspired against him. When he was at Tirzah, drinking himself drunk in the house of Arza, who was over the household in Tirzah,

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:10
verses.text: Zimri came in and struck him down and killed him, in the twenty-seventh year of Asa king of Judah, and reigned in his place.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:11
verses.text: When he began to reign, as soon as he had seated himself on his throne, he struck down all the house of Baasha. He did not leave him a single male of his relatives or his friends.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:12
verses.text: Thus Zimri destroyed all the house of Baasha, according to the word of the LORD, which he spoke against Baasha by Jehu the prophet,

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:13
verses.text: for all the sins of Baasha and the sins of Elah his son, which they sinned and which they made Israel to sin, provoking the LORD God of Israel to anger with their idols.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:14
verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Elah and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:15
verses.text: In the twenty-seventh year of Asa king of Judah, Zimri reigned seven days in Tirzah. Now the troops were encamped against Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines,

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:16
verses.text: and the troops who were encamped heard it said, "Zimri has conspired, and he has killed the king." Therefore all Israel made Omri, the commander of the army, king over Israel that day in the camp.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:17
verses.text: So Omri went up from Gibbethon, and all Israel with him, and they besieged Tirzah.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:18
verses.text: And when Zimri saw that the city was taken, he went into the citadel of the king's house and burned the king's house over him with fire and died,

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:19
verses.text: because of his sins that he committed, doing evil in the sight of the LORD, walking in the way of Jeroboam, and for his sin which he committed, making Israel to sin.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:20
verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Zimri, and the conspiracy that he made, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:21
verses.text: Then the people of Israel were divided into two parts. Half of the people followed Tibni the son of Ginath, to make him king, and half followed Omri.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:22
verses.text: But the people who followed Omri overcame the people who followed Tibni the son of Ginath. So Tibni died, and Omri became king.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:23
verses.text: In the thirty-first year of Asa king of Judah, Omri began to reign over Israel, and he reigned for twelve years; six years he reigned in Tirzah.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:24
verses.text: He bought the hill of Samaria from Shemer for two talents of silver, and he fortified the hill and called the name of the city that he built Samaria, after the name of Shemer, the owner of the hill.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:25
verses.text: Omri did what was evil in the sight of the LORD, and did more evil than all who were before him.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:26
verses.text: For he walked in all the way of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, and in the sins that he made Israel to sin, provoking the LORD, the God of Israel, to anger by their idols.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:27
verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Omri that he did, and the might that he showed, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:28
verses.text: And Omri slept with his fathers and was buried in Samaria, and Ahab his son reigned in his place.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:29
verses.text: In the thirty-eighth year of Asa king of Judah, Ahab the son of Omri began to reign over Israel, and Ahab the son of Omri reigned over Israel in Samaria twenty-two years.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:30
verses.text: And Ahab the son of Omri did evil in the sight of the LORD, more than all who were before him.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:31
verses.text: And as if it had been a light thing for him to walk in the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, he took for his wife Jezebel the daughter of Ethbaal king of the Sidonians, and went and served Baal and worshiped him.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:32
verses.text: He erected an altar for Baal in the house of Baal, which he built in Samaria.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:33
verses.text: And Ahab made an Asherah. Ahab did more to provoke the LORD, the God of Israel, to anger than all the kings of Israel who were before him.

verses.name: 1 Kings 16:34
verses.text: In his days Hiel of Bethel built Jericho. He laid its foundation at the cost of Abiram his firstborn, and set up its gates at the cost of his youngest son Segub, according to the word of the LORD, which he spoke by Joshua the son of Nun.

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:1
verses.text: Now Elijah the Tishbite, of Tishbe in Gilead, said to Ahab, "As the LORD the God of Israel lives, before whom I stand, there shall be neither dew nor rain these years, except by my word."

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:2
verses.text: And the word of the LORD came to him,

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:3
verses.text: "Depart from here and turn eastward and hide yourself by the brook Cherith, which is east of the Jordan.

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:4
verses.text: You shall drink from the brook, and I have commanded the ravens to feed you there."

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:5
verses.text: So he went and did according to the word of the LORD. He went and lived by the brook Cherith that is east of the Jordan.

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:6
verses.text: And the ravens brought him bread and meat in the morning, and bread and meat in the evening, and he drank from the brook.

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:7
verses.text: And after a while the brook dried up, because there was no rain in the land.

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:8
verses.text: Then the word of the LORD came to him,

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:9
verses.text: "Arise, go to Zarephath, which belongs to Sidon, and dwell there. Behold, I have commanded a widow there to feed you."

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:10
verses.text: So he arose and went to Zarephath. And when he came to the gate of the city, behold, a widow was there gathering sticks. And he called to her and said, "Bring me a little water in a vessel, that I may drink."

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:11
verses.text: And as she was going to bring it, he called to her and said, "Bring me a morsel of bread in your hand."

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:12
verses.text: And she said, "As the LORD your God lives, I have nothing baked, only a handful of flour in a jar and a little oil in a jug. And now I am gathering a couple of sticks that I may go in and prepare it for myself and my son, that we may eat it and die."

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:13
verses.text: And Elijah said to her, "Do not fear; go and do as you have said. But first make me a little cake of it and bring it to me, and afterward make something for yourself and your son.

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:14
verses.text: For thus says the LORD the God of Israel, 'The jar of flour shall not be spent, and the jug of oil shall not be empty, until the day that the LORD sends rain upon the earth.'"

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:15
verses.text: And she went and did as Elijah said. And she and he and her household ate for many days.

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:16
verses.text: The jar of flour was not spent, neither did the jug of oil become empty, according to the word of the LORD that he spoke by Elijah.

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:17
verses.text: After this the son of the woman, the mistress of the house, became ill. And his illness was so severe that there was no breath left in him.

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:18
verses.text: And she said to Elijah, "What have you against me, O man of God? You have come to me to bring my sin to remembrance and to cause the death of my son!"

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:19
verses.text: And he said to her, "Give me your son." And he took him from her arms and carried him up into the upper chamber where he lodged, and laid him on his own bed.

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:20
verses.text: And he cried to the LORD, "O LORD my God, have you brought calamity even upon the widow with whom I sojourn, by killing her son?"

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:21
verses.text: Then he stretched himself upon the child three times and cried to the LORD, "O LORD my God, let this child's life come into him again."

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:22
verses.text: And the LORD listened to the voice of Elijah. And the life of the child came into him again, and he revived.

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:23
verses.text: And Elijah took the child and brought him down from the upper chamber into the house and delivered him to his mother. And Elijah said, "See, your son lives."

verses.name: 1 Kings 17:24
verses.text: And the woman said to Elijah, "Now I know that you are a man of God, and that the word of the LORD in your mouth is truth."

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:1
verses.text: After many days the word of the LORD came to Elijah, in the third year, saying, "Go, show yourself to Ahab, and I will send rain upon the earth."

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:2
verses.text: So Elijah went to show himself to Ahab. Now the famine was severe in Samaria.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:3
verses.text: And Ahab called Obadiah, who was over the household. (Now Obadiah feared the LORD greatly,

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:4
verses.text: and when Jezebel cut off the prophets of the LORD, Obadiah took a hundred prophets and hid them by fifties in a cave and fed them with bread and water.)

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:5
verses.text: And Ahab said to Obadiah, "Go through the land to all the springs of water and to all the valleys. Perhaps we may find grass and save the horses and mules alive, and not lose some of the animals."

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:6
verses.text: So they divided the land between them to pass through it. Ahab went in one direction by himself, and Obadiah went in another direction by himself.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:7
verses.text: And as Obadiah was on the way, behold, Elijah met him. And Obadiah recognized him and fell on his face and said, "Is it you, my lord Elijah?"

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:8
verses.text: And he answered him, "It is I. Go, tell your lord, 'Behold, Elijah is here.'"

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:9
verses.text: And he said, "How have I sinned, that you would give your servant into the hand of Ahab, to kill me?

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:10
verses.text: As the LORD your God lives, there is no nation or kingdom where my lord has not sent to seek you. And when they would say, 'He is not here,' he would take an oath of the kingdom or nation, that they had not found you.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:11
verses.text: And now you say, 'Go, tell your lord, "Behold, Elijah is here."'

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:12
verses.text: And as soon as I have gone from you, the Spirit of the LORD will carry you I know not where. And so, when I come and tell Ahab and he cannot find you, he will kill me, although I your servant have feared the LORD from my youth.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:13
verses.text: Has it not been told my lord what I did when Jezebel killed the prophets of the LORD, how I hid a hundred men of the LORD's prophets by fifties in a cave and fed them with bread and water?

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:14
verses.text: And now you say, 'Go, tell your lord, "Behold, Elijah is here"'; and he will kill me."

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:15
verses.text: And Elijah said, "As the LORD of hosts lives, before whom I stand, I will surely show myself to him today."

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:16
verses.text: So Obadiah went to meet Ahab, and told him. And Ahab went to meet Elijah.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:17
verses.text: When Ahab saw Elijah, Ahab said to him, "Is it you, you troubler of Israel?"

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:18
verses.text: And he answered, "I have not troubled Israel, but you have, and your father's house, because you have abandoned the commandments of the LORD and followed the Baals.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:19
verses.text: Now therefore send and gather all Israel to me at Mount Carmel, and the 450 prophets of Baal and the 400 prophets of Asherah, who eat at Jezebel's table."

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:20
verses.text: So Ahab sent to all the people of Israel and gathered the prophets together at Mount Carmel.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:21
verses.text: And Elijah came near to all the people and said, "How long will you go limping between two different opinions? If the LORD is God, follow him; but if Baal, then follow him." And the people did not answer him a word.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:22
verses.text: Then Elijah said to the people, "I, even I only, am left a prophet of the LORD, but Baal's prophets are 450 men.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:23
verses.text: Let two bulls be given to us, and let them choose one bull for themselves and cut it in pieces and lay it on the wood, but put no fire to it. And I will prepare the other bull and lay it on the wood and put no fire to it.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:24
verses.text: And you call upon the name of your god, and I will call upon the name of the LORD, and the God who answers by fire, he is God." And all the people answered, "It is well spoken."

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:25
verses.text: Then Elijah said to the prophets of Baal, "Choose for yourselves one bull and prepare it first, for you are many, and call upon the name of your god, but put no fire to it."

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:26
verses.text: And they took the bull that was given them, and they prepared it and called upon the name of Baal from morning until noon, saying, "O Baal, answer us!" But there was no voice, and no one answered. And they limped around the altar that they had made.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:27
verses.text: And at noon Elijah mocked them, saying, "Cry aloud, for he is a god. Either he is musing, or he is relieving himself, or he is on a journey, or perhaps he is asleep and must be awakened."

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:28
verses.text: And they cried aloud and cut themselves after their custom with swords and lances, until the blood gushed out upon them.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:29
verses.text: And as midday passed, they raved on until the time of the offering of the oblation, but there was no voice. No one answered; no one paid attention.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:30
verses.text: Then Elijah said to all the people, "Come near to me." And all the people came near to him. And he repaired the altar of the LORD that had been thrown down.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:31
verses.text: Elijah took twelve stones, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Jacob, to whom the word of the LORD came, saying, "Israel shall be your name,"

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:32
verses.text: and with the stones he built an altar in the name of the LORD. And he made a trench about the altar, as great as would contain two seahs of seed.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:33
verses.text: And he put the wood in order and cut the bull in pieces and laid it on the wood. And he said, "Fill four jars with water and pour it on the burnt offering and on the wood."

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:34
verses.text: And he said, "Do it a second time." And they did it a second time. And he said, "Do it a third time." And they did it a third time.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:35
verses.text: And the water ran around the altar and filled the trench also with water.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:36
verses.text: And at the time of the offering of the oblation, Elijah the prophet came near and said, "O LORD, God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, let it be known this day that you are God in Israel, and that I am your servant, and that I have done all these things at your word.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:37
verses.text: Answer me, O LORD, answer me, that this people may know that you, O LORD, are God, and that you have turned their hearts back."

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:38
verses.text: Then the fire of the LORD fell and consumed the burnt offering and the wood and the stones and the dust, and licked up the water that was in the trench.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:39
verses.text: And when all the people saw it, they fell on their faces and said, "The LORD, he is God; the LORD, he is God."

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:40
verses.text: And Elijah said to them, "Seize the prophets of Baal; let not one of them escape." And they seized them. And Elijah brought them down to the brook Kishon and slaughtered them there.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:41
verses.text: And Elijah said to Ahab, "Go up, eat and drink, for there is a sound of the rushing of rain."

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:42
verses.text: So Ahab went up to eat and to drink. And Elijah went up to the top of Mount Carmel. And he bowed himself down on the earth and put his face between his knees.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:43
verses.text: And he said to his servant, "Go up now, look toward the sea." And he went up and looked and said, "There is nothing." And he said, "Go again," seven times.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:44
verses.text: And at the seventh time he said, "Behold, a little cloud like a man's hand is rising from the sea." And he said, "Go up, say to Ahab, 'Prepare your chariot and go down, lest the rain stop you.'"

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:45
verses.text: And in a little while the heavens grew black with clouds and wind, and there was a great rain. And Ahab rode and went to Jezreel.

verses.name: 1 Kings 18:46
verses.text: And the hand of the LORD was on Elijah, and he gathered up his garment and ran before Ahab to the entrance of Jezreel.

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:1
verses.text: Ahab told Jezebel all that Elijah had done, and how he had killed all the prophets with the sword.

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:2
verses.text: Then Jezebel sent a messenger to Elijah, saying, "So may the gods do to me and more also, if I do not make your life as the life of one of them by this time tomorrow."

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:3
verses.text: Then he was afraid, and he arose and ran for his life and came to Beersheba, which belongs to Judah, and left his servant there.

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:4
verses.text: But he himself went a day's journey into the wilderness and came and sat down under a broom tree. And he asked that he might die, saying, "It is enough; now, O LORD, take away my life, for I am no better than my fathers."

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:5
verses.text: And he lay down and slept under a broom tree. And behold, an angel touched him and said to him, "Arise and eat."

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:6
verses.text: And he looked, and behold, there was at his head a cake baked on hot stones and a jar of water. And he ate and drank and lay down again.

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:7
verses.text: And the angel of the LORD came again a second time and touched him and said, "Arise and eat, for the journey is too great for you."

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:8
verses.text: And he arose and ate and drank, and went in the strength of that food forty days and forty nights to Horeb, the mount of God.

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:9
verses.text: There he came to a cave and lodged in it. And behold, the word of the LORD came to him, and he said to him, "What are you doing here, Elijah?"

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:10
verses.text: He said, "I have been very jealous for the LORD, the God of hosts. For the people of Israel have forsaken your covenant, thrown down your altars, and killed your prophets with the sword, and I, even I only, am left, and they seek my life, to take it away."

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:11
verses.text: And he said, "Go out and stand on the mount before the LORD." And behold, the LORD passed by, and a great and strong wind tore the mountains and broke in pieces the rocks before the LORD, but the LORD was not in the wind. And after the wind an earthquake, but the LORD was not in the earthquake.

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:12
verses.text: And after the earthquake a fire, but the LORD was not in the fire. And after the fire the sound of a low whisper.

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:13
verses.text: And when Elijah heard it, he wrapped his face in his cloak and went out and stood at the entrance of the cave. And behold, there came a voice to him and said, "What are you doing here, Elijah?"

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:14
verses.text: He said, "I have been very jealous for the LORD, the God of hosts. For the people of Israel have forsaken your covenant, thrown down your altars, and killed your prophets with the sword, and I, even I only, am left, and they seek my life, to take it away."

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:15
verses.text: And the LORD said to him, "Go, return on your way to the wilderness of Damascus. And when you arrive, you shall anoint Hazael to be king over Syria.

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:16
verses.text: And Jehu the son of Nimshi you shall anoint to be king over Israel, and Elisha the son of Shaphat of Abel-meholah you shall anoint to be prophet in your place.

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:17
verses.text: And the one who escapes from the sword of Hazael shall Jehu put to death, and the one who escapes from the sword of Jehu shall Elisha put to death.

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:18
verses.text: Yet I will leave seven thousand in Israel, all the knees that have not bowed to Baal, and every mouth that has not kissed him."

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:19
verses.text: So he departed from there and found Elisha the son of Shaphat, who was plowing with twelve yoke of oxen in front of him, and he was with the twelfth. Elijah passed by him and cast his cloak upon him.

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:20
verses.text: And he left the oxen and ran after Elijah and said, "Let me kiss my father and my mother, and then I will follow you." And he said to him, "Go back again, for what have I done to you?"

verses.name: 1 Kings 19:21
verses.text: And he returned from following him and took the yoke of oxen and sacrificed them and boiled their flesh with the yokes of the oxen and gave it to the people, and they ate. Then he arose and went after Elijah and assisted him.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:1
verses.text: Ben-hadad the king of Syria gathered all his army together. Thirty-two kings were with him, and horses and chariots. And he went up and closed in on Samaria and fought against it.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:2
verses.text: And he sent messengers into the city to Ahab king of Israel and said to him, "Thus says Ben-hadad:

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:3
verses.text: 'Your silver and your gold are mine; your best wives and children also are mine.'"

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:4
verses.text: And the king of Israel answered, "As you say, my lord, O king, I am yours, and all that I have."

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:5
verses.text: The messengers came again and said, "Thus says Ben-hadad: 'I sent to you, saying, "Deliver to me your silver and your gold, your wives and your children."

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:6
verses.text: Nevertheless I will send my servants to you tomorrow about this time, and they shall search your house and the houses of your servants and lay hands on whatever pleases you and take it away.'"

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:7
verses.text: Then the king of Israel called all the elders of the land and said, "Mark, now, and see how this man is seeking trouble, for he sent to me for my wives and my children, and for my silver and my gold, and I did not refuse him."

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:8
verses.text: And all the elders and all the people said to him, "Do not listen or consent."

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:9
verses.text: So he said to the messengers of Ben-hadad, "Tell my lord the king, 'All that you first demanded of your servant I will do, but this thing I cannot do.'"And the messengers departed and brought him word again.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:10
verses.text: Ben-hadad sent to him and said, "The gods do so to me and more also, if the dust of Samaria shall suffice for handfuls for all the people who follow me."

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:11
verses.text: And the king of Israel answered, "Tell him, 'Let not him who straps on his armor boast himself like he who takes it off.'"

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:12
verses.text: When Ben-hadad heard this message as he was drinking with the kings in the booths, he said to his men, "Take your positions." And they took their positions against the city.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:13
verses.text: And behold, a prophet came near to Ahab king of Israel and said, "Thus says the LORD, Have you seen all this great multitude? Behold, I will give it into your hand this day, and you shall know that I am the LORD."

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:14
verses.text: And Ahab said, "By whom?" He said, "Thus says the LORD, By the servants of the governors of the districts." Then he said, "Who shall begin the battle?" He answered, "You."

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:15
verses.text: Then he mustered the servants of the governors of the districts, and they were 232. And after them he mustered all the people of Israel, seven thousand.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:16
verses.text: And they went out at noon, while Ben-hadad was drinking himself drunk in the booths, he and the thirty-two kings who helped him.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:17
verses.text: The servants of the governors of the districts went out first. And Ben-hadad sent out scouts, and they reported to him, "Men are coming out from Samaria."

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:18
verses.text: He said, "If they have come out for peace, take them alive. Or if they have come out for war, take them alive."

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:19
verses.text: So these went out of the city, the servants of the governors of the districts and the army that followed them.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:20
verses.text: And each struck down his man. The Syrians fled, and Israel pursued them, but Ben-hadad king of Syria escaped on a horse with horsemen.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:21
verses.text: And the king of Israel went out and struck the horses and chariots, and struck the Syrians with a great blow.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:22
verses.text: Then the prophet came near to the king of Israel and said to him, "Come, strengthen yourself, and consider well what you have to do, for in the spring the king of Syria will come up against you."

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:23
verses.text: And the servants of the king of Syria said to him, "Their gods are gods of the hills, and so they were stronger than we. But let us fight against them in the plain, and surely we shall be stronger than they.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:24
verses.text: And do this: remove the kings, each from his post, and put commanders in their places,

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:25
verses.text: and muster an army like the army that you have lost, horse for horse, and chariot for chariot. Then we will fight against them in the plain, and surely we shall be stronger than they." And he listened to their voice and did so.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:26
verses.text: In the spring, Ben-hadad mustered the Syrians and went up to Aphek to fight against Israel.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:27
verses.text: And the people of Israel were mustered and were provisioned and went against them. The people of Israel encamped before them like two little flocks of goats, but the Syrians filled the country.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:28
verses.text: And a man of God came near and said to the king of Israel, "Thus says the LORD, 'Because the Syrians have said, "The LORD is a god of the hills but he is not a god of the valleys," therefore I will give all this great multitude into your hand, and you shall know that I am the LORD.'"

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:29
verses.text: And they encamped opposite one another seven days. Then on the seventh day the battle was joined. And the people of Israel struck down of the Syrians 100,000 foot soldiers in one day.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:30
verses.text: And the rest fled into the city of Aphek, and the wall fell upon 27,000 men who were left. Ben-hadad also fled and entered an inner chamber in the city.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:31
verses.text: And his servants said to him, "Behold now, we have heard that the kings of the house of Israel are merciful kings. Let us put sackcloth around our waists and ropes on our heads and go out to the king of Israel. Perhaps he will spare your life."

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:32
verses.text: So they tied sackcloth around their waists and put ropes on their heads and went to the king of Israel and said, "Your servant Ben-hadad says, 'Please, let me live.'"And he said, "Does he still live? He is my brother."

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:33
verses.text: Now the men were watching for a sign, and they quickly took it up from him and said, "Yes, your brother Ben-hadad." Then he said, "Go and bring him." Then Ben-hadad came out to him, and he caused him to come up into the chariot.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:34
verses.text: And Ben-hadad said to him, "The cities that my father took from your father I will restore, and you may establish bazaars for yourself in Damascus, as my father did in Samaria." And Ahab said, "I will let you go on these terms." So he made a covenant with him and let him go.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:35
verses.text: And a certain man of the sons of the prophets said to his fellow at the command of the LORD, "Strike me, please." But the man refused to strike him.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:36
verses.text: Then he said to him, "Because you have not obeyed the voice of the LORD, behold, as soon as you have gone from me, a lion shall strike you down." And as soon as he had departed from him, a lion met him and struck him down.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:37
verses.text: Then he found another man and said, "Strike me, please." And the man struck him- struck him and wounded him.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:38
verses.text: So the prophet departed and waited for the king by the way, disguising himself with a bandage over his eyes.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:39
verses.text: And as the king passed, he cried to the king and said, "Your servant went out into the midst of the battle, and behold, a soldier turned and brought a man to me and said, 'Guard this man; if by any means he is missing, your life shall be for his life, or else you shall pay a talent of silver.'

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:40
verses.text: And as your servant was busy here and there, he was gone." The king of Israel said to him, "So shall your judgment be; you yourself have decided it."

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:41
verses.text: Then he hurried to take the bandage away from his eyes, and the king of Israel recognized him as one of the prophets.

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:42
verses.text: And he said to him, "Thus says the LORD, 'Because you have let go out of your hand the man whom I had devoted to destruction, therefore your life shall be for his life, and your people for his people.'"

verses.name: 1 Kings 20:43
verses.text: And the king of Israel went to his house vexed and sullen and came to Samaria.

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:1
verses.text: Now Naboth the Jezreelite had a vineyard in Jezreel, beside the palace of Ahab king of Samaria.

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:2
verses.text: And after this Ahab said to Naboth, "Give me your vineyard, that I may have it for a vegetable garden, because it is near my house, and I will give you a better vineyard for it; or, if it seems good to you, I will give you its value in money."

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:3
verses.text: But Naboth said to Ahab, "The LORD forbid that I should give you the inheritance of my fathers."

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:4
verses.text: And Ahab went into his house vexed and sullen because of what Naboth the Jezreelite had said to him, for he had said, "I will not give you the inheritance of my fathers." And he lay down on his bed and turned away his face and would eat no food.

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:5
verses.text: But Jezebel his wife came to him and said to him, "Why is your spirit so vexed that you eat no food?"

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:6
verses.text: And he said to her, "Because I spoke to Naboth the Jezreelite and said to him, 'Give me your vineyard for money, or else, if it please you, I will give you another vineyard for it.' And he answered, 'I will not give you my vineyard.'"

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:7
verses.text: And Jezebel his wife said to him, "Do you now govern Israel? Arise and eat bread and let your heart be cheerful; I will give you the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite."

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:8
verses.text: So she wrote letters in Ahab's name and sealed them with his seal, and she sent the letters to the elders and the leaders who lived with Naboth in his city.

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:9
verses.text: And she wrote in the letters, "Proclaim a fast, and set Naboth at the head of the people.

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:10
verses.text: And set two worthless men opposite him, and let them bring a charge against him, saying, 'You have cursed God and the king.' Then take him out and stone him to death."

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:11
verses.text: And the men of his city, the elders and the leaders who lived in his city, did as Jezebel had sent word to them. As it was written in the letters that she had sent to them,

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:12
verses.text: they proclaimed a fast and set Naboth at the head of the people.

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:13
verses.text: And the two worthless men came in and sat opposite him. And the worthless men brought a charge against Naboth in the presence of the people, saying, "Naboth cursed God and the king." So they took him outside the city and stoned him to death with stones.

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:14
verses.text: Then they sent to Jezebel, saying, "Naboth has been stoned; he is dead."

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:15
verses.text: As soon as Jezebel heard that Naboth had been stoned and was dead, Jezebel said to Ahab, "Arise, take possession of the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite, which he refused to give you for money, for Naboth is not alive, but dead."

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:16
verses.text: And as soon as Ahab heard that Naboth was dead, Ahab arose to go down to the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite, to take possession of it.

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:17
verses.text: Then the word of the LORD came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying,

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:18
verses.text: "Arise, go down to meet Ahab king of Israel, who is in Samaria; behold, he is in the vineyard of Naboth, where he has gone to take possession.

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:19
verses.text: And you shall say to him, 'Thus says the LORD, "Have you killed and also taken possession?"'And you shall say to him, 'Thus says the LORD: "In the place where dogs licked up the blood of Naboth shall dogs lick your own blood."'"

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:20
verses.text: Ahab said to Elijah, "Have you found me, O my enemy?" He answered, "I have found you, because you have sold yourself to do what is evil in the sight of the LORD.

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:21
verses.text: Behold, I will bring disaster upon you. I will utterly burn you up, and will cut off from Ahab every male, bond or free, in Israel.

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:22
verses.text: And I will make your house like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, and like the house of Baasha the son of Ahijah, for the anger to which you have provoked me, and because you have made Israel to sin.

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:23
verses.text: And of Jezebel the LORD also said, 'The dogs shall eat Jezebel within the walls of Jezreel.'

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:24
verses.text: Anyone belonging to Ahab who dies in the city the dogs shall eat, and anyone of his who dies in the open country the birds of the heavens shall eat."

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:25
verses.text: (There was none who sold himself to do what was evil in the sight of the LORD like Ahab, whom Jezebel his wife incited.

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:26
verses.text: He acted very abominably in going after idols, as the Amorites had done, whom the LORD cast out before the people of Israel.)

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:27
verses.text: And when Ahab heard those words, he tore his clothes and put sackcloth on his flesh and fasted and lay in sackcloth and went about dejectedly.

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:28
verses.text: And the word of the LORD came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying,

verses.name: 1 Kings 21:29
verses.text: "Have you seen how Ahab has humbled himself before me? Because he has humbled himself before me, I will not bring the disaster in his days; but in his son's days I will bring the disaster upon his house."

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:1
verses.text: For three years Syria and Israel continued without war.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:2
verses.text: But in the third year Jehoshaphat the king of Judah came down to the king of Israel.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:3
verses.text: And the king of Israel said to his servants, "Do you know that Ramoth-gilead belongs to us, and we keep quiet and do not take it out of the hand of the king of Syria?"

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:4
verses.text: And he said to Jehoshaphat, "Will you go with me to battle at Ramoth-gilead?" And Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, "I am as you are, my people as your people, my horses as your horses."

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:5
verses.text: And Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, "Inquire first for the word of the LORD."

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:6
verses.text: Then the king of Israel gathered the prophets together, about four hundred men, and said to them, "Shall I go to battle against Ramoth-gilead, or shall I refrain?" And they said, "Go up, for the Lord will give it into the hand of the king."

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:7
verses.text: But Jehoshaphat said, "Is there not here another prophet of the LORD of whom we may inquire?"

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:8
verses.text: And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, "There is yet one man by whom we may inquire of the LORD, Micaiah the son of Imlah, but I hate him, for he never prophesies good concerning me, but evil." And Jehoshaphat said, "Let not the king say so."

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:9
verses.text: Then the king of Israel summoned an officer and said, "Bring quickly Micaiah the son of Imlah."

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:10
verses.text: Now the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah were sitting on their thrones, arrayed in their robes, at the threshing floor at the entrance of the gate of Samaria, and all the prophets were prophesying before them.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:11
verses.text: And Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah made for himself horns of iron and said, "Thus says the LORD, 'With these you shall push the Syrians until they are destroyed.'"

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:12
verses.text: And all the prophets prophesied so and said, "Go up to Ramoth-gilead and triumph; the LORD will give it into the hand of the king."

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:13
verses.text: And the messenger who went to summon Micaiah said to him, "Behold, the words of the prophets with one accord are favorable to the king. Let your word be like the word of one of them, and speak favorably."

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:14
verses.text: But Micaiah said, "As the LORD lives, what the LORD says to me, that I will speak."

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:15
verses.text: And when he had come to the king, the king said to him, "Micaiah, shall we go to Ramoth-gilead to battle, or shall we refrain?" And he answered him, "Go up and triumph; the LORD will give it into the hand of the king."

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:16
verses.text: But the king said to him, "How many times shall I make you swear that you speak to me nothing but the truth in the name of the LORD?"

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:17
verses.text: And he said, "I saw all Israel scattered on the mountains, as sheep that have no shepherd. And the LORD said, 'These have no master; let each return to his home in peace.'"

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:18
verses.text: And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, "Did I not tell you that he would not prophesy good concerning me, but evil?"

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:19
verses.text: And Micaiah said, "Therefore hear the word of the LORD: I saw the LORD sitting on his throne, and all the host of heaven standing beside him on his right hand and on his left;

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:20
verses.text: and the LORD said, 'Who will entice Ahab, that he may go up and fall at Ramoth-gilead?' And one said one thing, and another said another.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:21
verses.text: Then a spirit came forward and stood before the LORD, saying, 'I will entice him.'

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:22
verses.text: And the LORD said to him, 'By what means?' And he said, 'I will go out, and will be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets.' And he said, 'You are to entice him, and you shall succeed; go out and do so.'

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:23
verses.text: Now therefore behold, the LORD has put a lying spirit in the mouth of all these your prophets; the LORD has declared disaster for you."

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:24
verses.text: Then Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah came near and struck Micaiah on the cheek and said, "How did the Spirit of the LORD go from me to speak to you?"

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:25
verses.text: And Micaiah said, "Behold, you shall see on that day when you go into an inner chamber to hide yourself."

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:26
verses.text: And the king of Israel said, "Seize Micaiah, and take him back to Amon the governor of the city and to Joash the king's son,

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:27
verses.text: and say, 'Thus says the king, "Put this fellow in prison and feed him meager rations of bread and water, until I come in peace."'"

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:28
verses.text: And Micaiah said, "If you return in peace, the LORD has not spoken by me." And he said, "Hear, all you peoples!"

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:29
verses.text: So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah went up to Ramoth-gilead.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:30
verses.text: And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, "I will disguise myself and go into battle, but you wear your robes." And the king of Israel disguised himself and went into battle.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:31
verses.text: Now the king of Syria had commanded the thirty-two captains of his chariots, "Fight with neither small nor great, but only with the king of Israel."

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:32
verses.text: And when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, they said, "It is surely the king of Israel." So they turned to fight against him. And Jehoshaphat cried out.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:33
verses.text: And when the captains of the chariots saw that it was not the king of Israel, they turned back from pursuing him.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:34
verses.text: But a certain man drew his bow at random and struck the king of Israel between the scale armor and the breastplate. Therefore he said to the driver of his chariot, "Turn around and carry me out of the battle, for I am wounded."

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:35
verses.text: And the battle continued that day, and the king was propped up in his chariot facing the Syrians, until at evening he died. And the blood of the wound flowed into the bottom of the chariot.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:36
verses.text: And about sunset a cry went through the army, "Every man to his city, and every man to his country!"

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:37
verses.text: So the king died, and was brought to Samaria. And they buried the king in Samaria.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:38
verses.text: And they washed the chariot by the pool of Samaria, and the dogs licked up his blood, and the prostitutes washed themselves in it, according to the word of the LORD that he had spoken.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:39
verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Ahab and all that he did, and the ivory house that he built and all the cities that he built, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:40
verses.text: So Ahab slept with his fathers, and Ahaziah his son reigned in his place.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:41
verses.text: Jehoshaphat the son of Asa began to reign over Judah in the fourth year of Ahab king of Israel.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:42
verses.text: Jehoshaphat was thirty-five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned twenty-five years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Azubah the daughter of Shilhi.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:43
verses.text: He walked in all the way of Asa his father. He did not turn aside from it, doing what was right in the sight of the LORD. Yet the high places were not taken away, and the people still sacrificed and made offerings on the high places.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:44
verses.text: Jehoshaphat also made peace with the king of Israel.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:45
verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat, and his might that he showed, and how he warred, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:46
verses.text: And from the land he exterminated the remnant of the male cult prostitutes who remained in the days of his father Asa.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:47
verses.text: There was no king in Edom; a deputy was king.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:48
verses.text: Jehoshaphat made ships of Tarshish to go to Ophir for gold, but they did not go, for the ships were wrecked at Ezion-geber.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:49
verses.text: Then Ahaziah the son of Ahab said to Jehoshaphat, "Let my servants go with your servants in the ships," but Jehoshaphat was not willing.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:50
verses.text: And Jehoshaphat slept with his fathers and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father, and Jehoram his son reigned in his place.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:51
verses.text: Ahaziah the son of Ahab began to reign over Israel in Samaria in the seventeenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, and he reigned two years over Israel.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:52
verses.text: He did what was evil in the sight of the LORD and walked in the way of his father and in the way of his mother and in the way of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin.

verses.name: 1 Kings 22:53
verses.text: He served Baal and worshiped him and provoked the LORD, the God of Israel, to anger in every way that his father had done.
